content.description:
The Tao of Pooh 5.7 ** 3 pitch G

Climbs the obvious corner system in the middle of the face, taking the line of least resistance (to the left) to avoid the upper overhangs.
content.location: The middle of the SE Buttress.

content.description:
Do first pitch of Climate Change.

Pitch 2: 5.10A From belay anchor, traverse left along ledge, then straight up to semi hanging belay.

Pitch 3: 5.12something. Climb up to a large overhang, then through the overhang to steep pocketed headwall above. I recommend bringing jumars (or prussic cord at a minimum) for the leader and follower. A fall off of the overhang can leave you stranded in space, without enough rope to lower. Great pitch!

Pitch 4: 5.10B Go right to merge with (short pitch 4) of Climate Change and continue up to large ledge system.

Pitch 5: 5.11B Final pitch is left of Climate Change. Same solid compact rock with great views from high up. Rappel Climate Change, from the large ledge, or walk off from top.
content.protection: Bolts, does not have rappel anchors above overhang. Rappel Climate Change, or walk off from top of cliff.  Bring jumars or prussic cord for leader and follower.  A fall from crux pitch can leave you stranded in space.
content.location: South Buttress of South Main Wall.  Easily distinguished, large overhang left of Climate Change.

content.description:
Pitch 1: 5.9 Start at a short finger crack and move right on to a clean face.  Follow the bolts to a chain anchor high up on the ledge.

Pitch 2: 5.10D Climb through the large huecos and pockets to thrilling finish just before the chain anchors at a ledge.  99 feet.

Pitch 3: 5.10a Move left off of the belay.  More pockets and interesting rock with a traverse back right to a chain anchor below a large overhang high on the wall.

This route does not top out.  Rap the route with one 60M rope.  You have to do some pendulum swings to get back over to the chain rap anchors.
content.protection: This route does not top out the cliff.  You can rap from any point with one 60M rope.  You have to pendulum around to get back to the chain rap anchors. Quick draws and long runners for pro.
content.location: South Buttress of the South Main Wall.  Climbs through the holey face right of the trad line.

content.description:
Pitch 1: 5.10B Good rock and 8 bolts takes you to a nice ledge and two bolt rappel anchor about 90 feet up the wall. Technical finish to a real enjoyable pitch.

Pitch 2: 5.11A Steep and positive 100 foot pitch on great rock. A real gem.

Pitch 3: 5.10D Right from the belay anchors and find your way through a roof. Stop at a two bolt anchor in a big gold ledge/ cave. One of the best belay positions in the canyon.

Pitch 4: 5.11A Climb right out the cave on positive holds to a headwall crux out of view of your belayer. Go past rap anchors to a ledge with two bolt anchors.

Pitch 5: 5.9 Climb up and then left to a clean face, to the top of the wall.

Rappel the route with one 60 meter rope or walk off. Gets a lot of sun and is sheltered from the north winds. Great climbing on steep, positive rock. Originally I linked pitches, and stopped less. The route has such great belay ledges, and to reduce rope drag, I recommend doing the route in five pitches.
content.protection: Well protected with bolts, chain rap anchors at belays, can rap from any place on route with single 60M.
content.location: South Buttress of the South Main Wall.

content.description:
Pitch 1: 5.10C  Follow 7 bolts past a few boulder moves to a two bolt rap anchor on a ledge.

Pitch 2: 5.11A  Follow 9 bolts straight up, through some great featured rock to a two bolt rap anchor in a large pocket.

Pitch 3: 5.11A  Amazing steep pitch on great rock to a nice ledge.  7 bolts, 98 feet.

Pitch 4: 5.10B Short pitch to large ledge system. 3 bolts

Pitch 5: 5.11A  Great final pitch on stellar compact rock.
content.protection: Multi pitch sport route, well protected, and chain rappel anchors at belays.  Good ledges at belay stations.
content.location: South Buttress of the South Main Wall.  You can rap the whole route with one 60 meter rope (5 rappels), or walk off.
